LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingToggleDescActive: Enabled: colonists will dye their clothes automatically.
LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingToggleDescInactive: Disabled: colonists will not dye their clothes automatically.
LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingIdeoToggleDescActive: Prefer Ideology Color. Favorite Color is secondary.
LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingIdeoToggleDescInactive: Prefer Favorite Color. Ideology Color is secondary.
LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingPartialDesc: Colonists will dye enough clothes to get a mood bonus using Preferred Color.
LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingFullDesc: Colonists will dye all clothes using Preferred Color.
LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingTwoColorDesc: Colonists will dye all clothes with two colors, using primary as preferred.
LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingOverridingToggleDescAct: Enabled: always dye apparel with inactive coloring.
LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingOverridingToggleDescIna: Disabled: do not dye apparel with inactive coloring if not necessary.
LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingOverridingNote: Most artifacts, looted apparel and some crafted apparel (ex. simple and advanced helmets) have inactive coloring (i.e. they're normally not dyed).
LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingPatternsToggleDescActiv: Enabled: dye apparel according to coloring patterns.
LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingPatternsToggleDescInact: Disabled: do not use coloring patterns.
LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingPatternsToggleDesc: If both "patterns" and "dye self" options are enabled, "patterns" will have priority over the latter.
LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingOverridingAlwaysDesc: Always: colonists will ignore that items have inactive coloring.
LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingOverridingRequiredDesc: When Needed: colonists will ignore inactive coloring when it's required to get a bonus mood.
LanguageData.CommandSelfDyeingOverridingNeverDesc: Never: colonists will not dye items with inactive coloring.
